fs.polyglot.model
Class VariantTableModel

java.lang.Object
  fs.polyglot.model.VariantTableModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.swing.table.TableModel
public class VariantTableModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.table.TableModel

Implements a table model for diplaying / editing variants of a given string id in a given table. Variants are statically loaded, i.e. not updated, if the table is changed

Author:
hampe

Constructor Summary
VariantTableModel(java.lang.String stringID, StringEditorConfiguration config, PolyglotTableModel table, PolyglotStringLoader loader, java.lang.String languageID)
           
 
Method Summary
 void addTableModelListener(javax.swing.event.TableModelListener arg0)
          Adds a listener
 java.lang.Class<?> getColumnClass(int arg0)
          Returns String.class
 int getColumnCount()
          There are always three columns
 java.lang.String getColumnName(int arg0)
          The first column is named 'Language', the second 'Variant', the third has no name
 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getLanguageList()
          Returns a list of all language IDs in the model
 java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getOriginalLanguageList()
          Returns a list of language IDs that were displayed before any edit occurred.
 int getRowCount()
          There is one row more than there are languages
 java.lang.Object getValueAt(int arg0, int arg1)
          Except for the last row, returns the language ID in the first column, the variant in the second row and nothing in the third column.
 java.lang.String getVariant(java.lang.String languageID)
           
 boolean isCellEditable(int arg0, int arg1)
          Returns true for all cells which are not in the last row and only for the language cell in the last row
 void removeRow(int row)
          Removes the entry in the specified row, if 0 <= row < getRowCount-1 (the last row cannot be deleted)
 void removeTableModelListener(javax.swing.event.TableModelListener arg0)
           
 void setValueAt(java.lang.Object value, int row, int col)
          If the cell adressed is a cell in the first or second column, the following happens:
- If an existing language or variant is changed, this change will be adopted and all listeners notified
- If a language is added in the last row, it is added with an empty variant and all listeners are notified

equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

getValueAt

public java.lang.Object getValueAt(int arg0,
                                   int arg1)
Except for the last row, returns the language ID in the first column, the variant in the second row and nothing in the third column. The last row is empty

Specified by:
getValueAt in interface javax.swing.table.TableModel

isCellEditable

public boolean isCellEditable(int arg0,
                              int arg1)
Returns true for all cells which are not in the last row and only for the language cell in the last row

setValueAt

public void setValueAt(java.lang.Object value,
                       int row,
                       int col)
If the cell adressed is a cell in the first or second column, the following happens:
- If an existing language or variant is changed, this change will be adopted and all listeners notified
- If a language is added in the last row, it is added with an empty variant and all listeners are notified

Specified by:
setValueAt in interface javax.swing.table.TableModel
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - - If the indices are out of bounds.
